datasets.name: pivot.csv
datasets.description: This dataset provides a comprehensive overview of cell clusters and their annotations within the mouse brain. It includes detailed information on neurotransmitter types and hierarchical classifications such as class, subclass, supertype, and cluster, which are essential for understanding the functional diversity and specialization of brain cells.

raw.name: cluster_annotation_term_set_name
raw.description: This column denotes the name of the annotation term set, which specifies the type of classification applied to the cell clusters. For instance, it might indicate whether the classification pertains to neurotransmitter type, cell class, or another categorization, thus providing insight into the biological role and characteristics of the clusters.

raw.name: neurotransmitter
raw.description: This column identifies the type of neurotransmitter associated with each cell cluster, such as Glutamate (Glut). Neurotransmitters are chemical messengers that facilitate communication between neurons, and their identification is crucial for understanding the signaling pathways and functional roles of different cell types in the nervous system.

raw.name: class
raw.description: The class column categorizes cells into broad types based on their general characteristics and functions. This high-level classification helps in distinguishing major cell types, such as neuronal or glial cells, and serves as a foundational step in the hierarchical classification process.

raw.name: subclass
raw.description: This column provides a more detailed categorization within the cell type, offering finer distinctions between cells that belong to the same class. Subclassification allows researchers to explore the diversity and specialization within broader cell types, aiding in the identification of unique functional roles and properties.

raw.name: supertype
raw.description: The supertype column represents an even higher-level classification that encompasses multiple subclasses. It provides a broader context for understanding the relationships and similarities between different cell types, facilitating the study of overarching patterns and themes in brain cell organization.

raw.name: cluster
raw.description: This column assigns a specific cluster designation to each cell, grouping similar cells based on shared characteristics such as gene expression profiles. Clustering is a critical analytical technique for identifying patterns and associations within complex biological data, enabling researchers to infer functional similarities and differences among cells.

queries.question: Plot a stacked bar distribution graph for each class in each neurotransmitter.
